intro: Pamianthe cardenasii, commonly known as the Cienaga plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in wetlands and riverbanks. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
